page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY IN LEADENHAM
page.content: Leadenham was formerly called Long Leadenham or Long Leddesham.Leddesham meaning "Village on the Ledge" and Long coming from the development of the village on the line of the ledge. The word Long was eventually dropped and the spelling altered to Leadenham. Gospel Lane has no connections with the Church but used to be Goose Pool Lane,the lane leading to the pool where the village geese were kept.An unusual road name is that of Lemon Wong lane often called Limalong Lane by local residents.The origin of the name has been given in two ways,though they both tie in together.A wong was the name for a piece of land and Leman or Lehman either a paramour or a pear tree!As the pear tree was the old symbol for infidelity - Lemon Wong Lane was the boundary of the piece of land given by a lord to his mistress.
